messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Samurai Essay
messages.msgSnippet: ... I m afraid you re missing a few key points. Samurai were a social class. This answers your first two questions. One was BORN into it. No one was
messages.messageBody:
On Jan 17, 2008, at 12:29 PM, samuraiprofiler wrote:

> Hi, I'm writing an essay about samurais. I was wondering if anyone
> could answer my following questions. If you can't, do you know about
> any websites where I can email someone about it?
> Here is the questions
>
> 1. How old were the boys when they were recruited as samurais?
> 2. Did you have to be of the the upper class to be become one?
> 3. Did they got to war against each other?
>
>

I'm afraid you're missing a few key points.

Samurai were a social class. This answers your first two questions.

One was BORN into it. No one was "recruited" as a samurai.

And as to three: of COURSE. They were the warrior class, of course
they did.

To write an essay, you really should READ some material rather than
just asking questions. Let the material you read produce the questions
as they answer others. Just about any cursory reading of ANYTHING on
samurai (for example, the wikipedia article) would have had the
answers to these questions.

Tony

messages.subject: Samurai Essay
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, I m writing an essay about samurais. I was wondering if anyone could answer my following questions. If you can t, do you know about any websites where I
messages.messageBody:
Hi, I'm writing an essay about samurais. I was wondering if anyone
could answer my following questions. If you can't, do you know about
any websites where I can email someone about it?
Here is the questions

1. How old were the boys when they were recruited as samurais?
2. Did you have to be of the the upper class to be become one?
3. Did they got to war against each other?

These are my questions, it would be really great if you could take
some time to answer some of the questions. Thanks beforehand.
